revised_title: On the Temperature at Which Bacteria, Vibriones, and Their Supposed Germs are Killed in Fluids and Exposed to Heat
tldr: The author investigates the temperature at which bacteria and vibriones, along with their supposed germs, are killed when immersed in fluids or exposed to heat. The experiments reveal that these organisms are killed at a temperature of 140°F (60°C) in neutral or slightly alkaline fluids, debunking previous beliefs and theories.
